title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online. There is a personality quiz that takes forever. They take this seriously. Answer as a team player.

HR will call you and ask you how much you make and want. They'll ask why you are seeking a change.

Majority of the 2020-2021 hires have no hospital CM experience. The people hired after me: came from bedside, owned a daycare (worked in a hospital a long time ago), stay at home wife (RN). If you have CM experience, you will probably get a job offer.

Your first interview will be with director. He talks so much. The interview is him talking and needing an audience, more than it is about you and your experience. If you're an active listener, meaning letting director talk, he'll likely like you and you'll get invited to a peer interview. 

He has already coached the group on the peer interview to accept you. They actually get penalized if they say anything negative.

HR will do job offer by phone. If you accept, there is a drug test and background check.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 
What's a tough case you've had?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: New Grad here: I was contacted by the talent agency and did a 20 minute interview on the phone. They asked me several questions: why they should hire me, what could i bring to the team, why the unit I chose, why did I like that field of nursing... Once that was finished, I was informed that they would like to have a 3 part in person interview. I had a 40 minute interview/crash course about important logistical aspects of the hospital (benefits, wages, health care). I had to provide 2 references, CPR card, License, my transcript, and when I received my nurses license. Then after that I had an interview with the nurse manager on the unit. She asked me several questions. Because she liked me I continued with on with a peer interview and spoke to 2 nurses on the unit which lasted 15 minutes. They told me about the unit and also asked me several questions. I was told that I would hear back from them in a week. I got a call the next day with a job offer. Being a new grad I was very excited to start my nursing career on the unit I wanted. New grads, please expect your starting pay to be $26 hourly, this is standard (but there is a night time differential). The interview process was long, but as long as you practice questions you should be fine. Show up prepared, dress professionally, and make sure you know how to sell yourself.
Interview Questions:
Phone Interview:
1) What can you bring to the hospital?
2) What are 3 qualities about yourself?
3) Describe a difficult situation in nursing and how you resolved it?
Nurse manager interview:
4) What can you contribute to the nursing team?
5) Why did you choose this field of nursing?
6) Do you like day or night shift and why?
7)What can you contribute to the team?
-Why should we hire you?
Peer Interview:
8) Why ___ Unit?
9) What can you bring to the team?
10) Why did you choose nursing?
11) Do you have any questions you would like to ask?
My Questions to them:
1) what is the patient population?
2) what is the orientation process like?
3) what benefits do you offer your employees?
4) what qualities do you look for in potential employees?

title: Director of Information Technology Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for a Director position and from application to offer letter the process took 6 weeks. In that time I was asked to come into the hospital for interviews six times within a month. I met with numerous leaders including folks from HR and a few members of the C-suite as well as peers of the role I was applying for. To say the process was comprehensive is accurate. To say that it was disjointed and poorly managed is also accurate.

Because the salary was not mentioned at the outset by HR, I used the six interviews as a process of discovery. The online job description was sufficiently vague and, it took several interviews to understand the true depth and breadth of the position. 
Additionally, while interviewing at VHC, I was interviewing elsewhere and I let my recruiter know.  As the interview process was coming to a conclusion I let the recruiter know I may have multiple offers coming in at the same time.

When I finally received the offer it was past 5 p.m. on a Friday. Despite her flattery about me being their top choice, I felt the compensation was low by about 10%-15%, which I expected as the beginning offer in a brief negotiation. Then, just before we hung up, the recruiter told me (a bit too firmly) that she needed to hear back by 10 AM Monday, giving me exactly one business hour to make my decision. That business hour was important because I had not heard back on my other offers by 9:30 AM on Monday so I called the recruiter to ask for another day to make my decision. She sounded shocked I would need another 24 hours after they had put me through a month -long interview process, but said she would ask the hiring manager. 

I reiterated that I likely had another offer coming in for consideration and wanted to make an informed decision. At this point the recruiter seemed to be holding back her anger when she stated that she wasn't aware I was considering other offers, that this was the first time she was hearing of this. I calmly reminded her that I had mentioned this before. I inquired about the compensation, indicating that I thought the offer was low based on my market value and my increased understanding of the role. I countered with a slightly inflated number knowing this was a negotiation and that we'd likely settle somewhere in the middle. In reality, I expected the final number to be around 10% higher than the initial offer.

This was when the recruiter really showed her teeth. She stated that while I was their number one candidate the salary was set in stone because I lacked knowledge of two key areas which, arguably, are two of my strongest. After six interviews and time with my resume, their assessment of me was completely off base. Red flag. She said there would be no negotiation. I said, "OK, good to know” and stated that I would be back in touch later that day or the next with my decision. 

Ninety minutes later I received an EMAIL rescinding my offer and letting me know they went with another candidate.
Interview Questions: Have you handled major systems replacements and worked to manage several other projects at the same time to ensure interoperability.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
I feel as though the process was very thorough. First, within a few days of submitting an application, I received a call from someone with the recruitment. There was a 45 minute prescreen/phone interview. She was friendly and very helpful with any questions I had.
Next, I came in for an interview. I met with the same person I spoke with on the phone, she walked me through all of the great benefits of working with VHC and then walked a winding maze to the unit I was interviewing for. I did an interview both with the unit manager and then with a few staff nurses, which I can appreciate that they care about letting the nurses have a say on who they bring in and I can see the style of nurses that I can expect to work with. 
Followinf the interview, came a Talentplus phone interview that I had to schedule. They said it would take about an hour, but I'm pretty open, honest, and straight to the point. Imagine my horror when it ended in 30 minutes. I thought I had lost my chance at a great hospital. 
About 5-6 days later, including a weekend, I got got a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: For the in person interview, just Google top nursing interview questions. That's what I did, and there was no question that I hadn't heard before from those lists. Be prepared!

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Ver involved interview process by HR, Supervisor of department, and staff in department. They hire a company to ask moral, decision making questions, that have no right or wrong answers?!
Interview Questions: I can't think of one in particular,  but some were very leading as do you smile a lot?

title: Clinical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume, had screening interview with HR, then a Phone interview with potential supervisor. I traveled to the hospital at my own expense and then in person interview including peer interview.
Interview Questions: What value will you bring to the hospital?

title: Director of Radiology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at VHC Health
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process as follows:
1 Behavioral Questions interview: Outside vendor
1 phone interview: Director of HR
1 onsite interview: including VP of HR, Director of Radiology Group, VP of Ancillary Services, COO
2nd onsite interview: COO, CEO, VP of HR, Director of recruiting.
Interview Questions: Onsite interview were easy, the 1 hour and 15 minute behavioral questioning by an outside vendor was the most difficult part of all interviews.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health
Interview Descriptions: Iniitial interview was done during an open house.  It was harmless. I spoke to a couple of staff nurses and was then given a tour.  I returned for another interview with the PCD.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask me any clinical scenarios...just your basic 'What do you do when you have a problem with a co-worker?'

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview and met with the PCD and then had a peer interview right after that. I liked having the peer interview because in a way it also allowed me to be able to interview the unit and the people and see if it would be a good fit for both parties. After this they then decided to hire me and immediately took me to do a drug test. It was pretty convenient because I did not have to go to another facility or arrange to come back another day and use up another personal day from my work. Keep in mind to put aside about 2-3 hours to be safe for the interview especially if you are doing peer interview as well that day. The nurses are working so it does not always happen quickly and you might end up waiting about 15 minutes to start the peer interview but it is worth the wait to get to meet some of your future fellow nurses and techs.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you had a disagreement with a co-worker and how did you handle it.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: You will first be contacted by recruitment for a pre-screening interview by phone. Next, if your selected you will be invited to an in-person interview with the hiring manager. After the department hiring manager interviews you, you will be interviewed a second time by peers.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in customer service or call taking?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: applied online & was contacted 2 days later for phone screen, passed phone screen and had the in person interview with hr to do paperwork and the patient care director, another w/ staff on the unit, then got invited to do the talent plus interview, called 6 days later w/ offer
Interview Questions: Please illustrate a time when you had to make improvements.

title: Coder I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Four interviews! Four interviews! Four interviews! 
Even after an awesome resume and with a certification!
1 I had an over the phone with recruiter
2 I had an over the phone with director
3 I had an interview in person with the two directors
4 And then I had a peer interview with I think four or five people.
Interview Questions: How long have you been coding?

title: Manager/Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Online application resulted in telephone interview lasting 45 minutes

Selected to interview face to face with HR Recruitment and have professional references and photo ID.  Interviewed with 2 recruiters and had a tour of the hospital, took over 2 hours.  Both recruiters were warm, friendly, optimistic and appear to believe they work for the best organization.

After passing the face to face interviews with HR, I was scheduled for a Talent Plus telephone interview that lasted nearly 90 minutes  asking questions to gauge if my personality would be suitable working at Virginia Hospital Center.   Some of the questions were personal and I felt uncomfortable with the style of the telephone interview as well as some of the questions.    The Talent Plus interviewer was very impersonal and fired off questions very quickly.  Told the hospital recruiter would follow up within 48 hours, but they would never release the results of the Talent Plus  interview to me or tell my why I was not considered for a position.   Even if they hired me, they still do not share the Talent Plus interview results.   

It's been weeks & no response from them.  Has not checked references or background check.

The Virginia Hospital Center bases all hires on their personalities, not necessarily the persons skills, education, qualifications or experience.   You are not permitted to meet with the hiring managers unless you pass the Talent Plus interview.   Very frustrating to go through all the interviews and the personality tests and get no feedback at all.   If you don't pass the Talent Plus test, you are barred from future employment at this hospital.   All internal staff must go through the same process for advancement or transfers,  if they don't pass the Talent Plus, they are never considered suitable for advancement.
Interview Questions: How do you handle departmental conflicts?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at VHC Health (Arlington, VA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It's a long process. You have to apply through HR and then follow up with both HR and the department in which you want to work before they'll interview you. And before you can get an in-person interview, you have to do an hour-long phone interview with a screening company that asks a bunch of open-ended questions about your character and integrity.
Interview Questions: Do you know what's involved in the role of a unit secretary?
